page.title: 11COASTLINE
page.content: The area to the western boundary of the survey has the larger of two caravan parks in an area known as {Fontygary.}There is a swimming pool, as well as tennis courts, a shop and a club-house to be used by guests. This also is served by a flat,sandy beach. The{tides}which are prevalent in the Bristol Channel however make unsupervised swimming a dangerous occupation. There is therefore a well established{Surf-Lifesaving Club}which meets once a week in the winter and every day in the summer. They specialise in two rescue techniques. Firstly, they use surf canoes and secondly the more obvious beach rescue techniques a la BONDI Beach! The club sends competitors each year to the World Surf Lifesaving Championships and has built up a very good reputation.
